Description: The EPA and the Department of Justice announced a Clean Air Act settlement with Orion Engineered Carbons designed to significantly reduce air pollution from four carbon black manufacturing plants in Louisiana, Ohio and Texas. The settlement included a civil penalty of $800,000, spending of $550,000 on  environmental mitigation projects, and the installation of pollution control equipment that the EPA estimated would cost more than $100 million.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

NAICS Translation: 324199: All Other Petroleum and Coal Products Manufacturing
